msContents.summary: This papyrus contains a petition directed to the demosioi of Theadelphia by a certain Patron, son of Maron, who lives in the metropolis of the Arsinoite nome. Patron apparently had a house in Theadelphia and he submits the petition to report the situation to the police and to request that Chairemon give security to restrain him from further instances of illegal entry.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: This papyrus is medium brown in color and the ink is clear and dark. The papyrus was folded in half horizontally and then three times vertically from right to left, forming eight equal panels. These folds account for the loss of all the upper left margin and for the poor state of preservation of the text at lines 12-24.

handDesc.p: The hand is a firm and deliberate professional cursive. The left margin is missing for over half the document, but where it is preserved after line 17, it is only a centimeter in width. The right margin is intact and the writing fills the lines; final letters of the shorter lines are enlarged and extended towards the right.

div.ab: "To the police of the village of Theadelphia from Patron, son of Maron, from the metropolis. On the night preceding the first day of the present month of Pauni in the present <fourth> year, it was reported to me by relatives that a certain Chairemon, son of Asklepiades, a wool carder, scaled the wall and entered the house of Areios which adjoins mine . . . being watchful lest somewhat later on some malicious action be committed by him because of the fact that our house is united with the house of Areios. Wherefore I submit this petition so that this may be made clear to you and he give security lest something be done by him later on.;Year four of Lucius Septimius Severus Pius Pertinax Augustus Pauni . . . "
